forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain before 4am, then a chance of rain showers between 4am and 5am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind around 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, this afternoon unfolds under a canopy of partly sunny skies, although the scene is marked by a muted coolness that nudges temperatures down to a brisk 56. The winds carry a gentle whisper from the west, occasionally gusting playfully, suggesting that a light jacket would make an ideal companion for anyone venturing outside. As evening approaches, a chance of rain lingers softly in the air, elusive and almost poetic, poised to appear but not certain. The clouds gather more densely, forming a shroud that hints at the possibility of light rainfall—a reminder of the city’s capricious ways.

The visibility is tinged with a hint of haziness, as the iconic structures loom amidst an elusive marine layer, creating an atmosphere slightly shrouded in mystery. As twilight beckons, it becomes prudent to consider cozy attire—perhaps a lightweight sweater layered beneath a water-resistant jacket. This evening offers an invitation for simple pleasures; a stroll along the waterfront, with the sensation of the cool breeze against your skin, or perhaps a quiet seat in a nearby café, sipping a warm beverage while watching the world pass by in its usual, unhurried rhythm. The city's charm persists, urging one to embrace the nuances of the season.
